isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM WITH TRACTION CONTROL: BENDIX - 9200, 9300 and 9400 - REMOVAL

caution.para: Turn traction control off whenever servicing rear axle/wheel components with the truck on stands. This prevents unexpected firing of M-21 solenoids.

note.para: Before disconnecting ANY electrical circuits in the antilock system, the ignition key must be in the OFF position. If the key is not OFF, the controller will record the open circuit(s) as a fault.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface and block the wheels.
Drain the air pressure from all vehicle reservoirs.
Identify and mark or label all air lines and their respective connections on the valve to facilitate ease of installation.
Disconnect both air lines and the electrical connector.
Remove the valve from the vehicle.
